sentences.en: a story intended to titillate the imagination of the public
sentences.cn: 意欲煽动公众想象力的故事

sentences.en: Chilli sauce can titillate our palates.
sentences.cn: 辣椒酱可以挑逗我们的味觉.

sentences.en: In review a novel, you shall try to titillate rather than satiate the reader's interest.
sentences.cn: 评论一本小说的时候, 你应想办法刺激而不是满足读者的兴趣.

sentences.en: In reviewing a novel, you should try to titillate rather than satiate the reader's interest.
sentences.cn: 评论一本小说时, 你应设法刺激而不是满足读者的兴趣.

sentences.en: Once you decide to titillate instead of illuminate , you are on a slippery slope ( Bill Moyers )
sentences.cn: 当你决定仅从中取乐,而不好好思考时, 你的行动就可能招致失败和耻辱. ( 比尔·莫耶斯 )

sentences.en: Scientific stories titillate the fancy of the school boys.
sentences.cn: 科学故事使小学生们的想象力活跃起来.

sentences.en: Scientific stories titillate the fancy of the schoolboys.
sentences.cn: 科学故事使小学生们的想像力活跃起来.

sentences.en: The book has no artistic merit and its sole aim is to titillate ( the reader ).
sentences.cn: 那书毫无艺术价值,只是撩拨 ( 读者 ) 情欲.

sentences.en: The book has no artistic merit its sole aim is to titillate ( the reader ).
sentences.cn: 那书毫无艺术价值,只是撩拨 ( 读者 ) 情欲.

sentences.en: The book has no artistic merit its sole aim is to titillate.
sentences.cn: 那书毫无艺术价值,只是撩拨情欲.

sentences.en: The pictures were not meant to titillate audiences.
sentences.cn: 这些图片不是用来挑逗观众的.

trans.tran_cn: 觉得痒，被激发，感到兴奋
